Debrief.Wrappers.Track

Class LightweightTrackWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • MWC.GUI.PlainWrapper
      • Debrief.Wrappers.Track.LightweightTrackWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Plottable>, ColoredWatchable, WatchableList, CanEnumerate, Editable, Exportable, HasEditables, Layer, Plottable, Renamable, SupportsPropertyListeners, RightClickCutCopyAdaptor.IsTransientForChildren
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TrackWrapper

    public class LightweightTrackWrapper
extends PlainWrapper
implements WatchableList, Plottable, Layer, RightClickCutCopyAdaptor.IsTransientForChildren

        Description copied from interface: WatchableList
        get the watchable in this list nearest to the specified DTG. If the watchable list has start/finish times, only return a fix if the DTG supplied is during the "live" period of the watchables. If not DTG is present, or an invalid DTG is requested ,return all valid points

      • getUnfilteredItems

        public final java.util.Collection<Editable> getUnfilteredItems(HiResDate start,
                                                               HiResDate end)
        get the set of fixes contained within this time period which haven't been filtered, and which have valid depths. The isVisible flag indicates whether a track has been filtered or not. We also have the getVisibleFixesBetween method (below) which decides if a fix is visible if it is set to Visible, and it's label or symbol are visible.

        We don't have to worry about a valid depth, since 3d doesn't show points with invalid depth values

        Parameters:
        start - start DTG
        end - end DTG
        Returns:
        series of fixes
